div.sent: Siddhartha attained Buddhahood in 588 B.C.
He became the Buddha in the full moon night of Vesakha.
The knowledge He acquired through the attainment of supreme knowledge of wisdom are Four Noble truths.
The knowledge of the Noble Eightfold Path are within Four Noble Truths.
The Four Noble Truth means the four supreme knowledge of wisdom.
The first truth refers to human life that full of sufferings caused by craving.
The second truth is that the sufferings will continue till cravings exist in human life.
The third noble truth is that human beings may get rid of sufferings by the cessation of cravings.
The fourth noble truth is that there is a way to cessation of sufferings.
The performance of extreme meditation and enjoying the earthly pleasure both are not applicable for the destruction of cravings.
Avoiding these two extremities the middle path should be adopted.
It is possible to get rid of sufferings even living an earthly life.
Salvation from sufferings forever is Nibbana.
The middle path that we adopt for attaining Nibbana follows the Noble Eightfold Path.
So the Noble Eightfold Path is the knowledge that included in the Four Noble-Truth.
For the realization of the Noble Eightfold Path we should come across the Four Noble Truth.
The Noble Eightfold Path bears a great significance in Buddhism.
Without the performance of the Noble Eightfold Path it is quite impossible to attain Nibbana.
Nobody can deny that the earth is full of sufferings.
But everybody tries to get rid of sufferings for attaining happiness in his own life.
This is the reason that everybody wishes to be happy deceiving the others.
Even for his own happiness none hesitates to kill the others.
But this is not the way to be happy.
We should know that one's happiness is as similar as the happiness of others.
The Buddha however, declared that the sufferings of all the living beings are quite similar to one another.
Thus he could find out the way to the cessation of sufferings.
He at first, found out the actual cause of sufferings and there after proclaimed how to overcome them.
What is the real path to destroy the sufferings?
He said that there is no other alternative excepting the Noble Eightfold Path for the destruction of sufferings.
So this path bears a great significance in Buddhism.
Moreover, it is necessary to find out the way to dispel-the cravings.
How and on which way should we proceed to destroy the cravings?
Renunciation or engaging both mind and body in deep concentration should be avoided.
Again extreme earthly pleasure is a great hindrance to attain salvation.
None of these two extremities should be adopted.
Middle path is the best way for us to proceed ahead.
Because man is a social being living in the society with the members of the family and neighbouring people.
Thus living in the society the ways and means should be found out to observe the middle path.
Now we shall try to realize what the Noble Eightfold Path is.
Ariya means the best with eight essential parts.
Magga means the way.
So the Noble Eightfold Path should be followed as described here.
The Eightfold path is to attain the Nibbana by removing Tanha.
The first step of the Noble Eightfold Path is the Right view or intention.
It is supposed to have the real knowledge of the Four Noble Truths.
The earth is full of sufferings which are found in various forms.
To be born on earth is suffering.
The human baby cries as soon as it is born.
The suffering follows as it grows up.
The earthly life is full of sufferings.
Craving is the root of all sorts of sufferings.
The excessive craving of human being brings these sufferings.
Man can get rid of sufferings if craving is totally destroyed.
The word Samma means right or accurate and samma ditti refers to Right view.
Man is liable to his own activities.
Right activities bear a good result while bad activities result bad.
Right view consists of three stages namely, common practiced and over practiced.
The over practiced are those who have attained the knowledge of Arahanthood.
It means honest or the best desire.
If a man selfishly wishes to increase his power and wealth, it leads him to a great loss.
So he should avoid worldly pleasure and luxury awakenning the spirit of renunciation in mind.
This is also not enough.
He should wish welfare of others eliminating all evil thoughts.
Besides he has to show amity with love and compassion to others for their prosperity and happiness.
It brings peace of mind and kindness to all.
So it is right thought.
It refers to honest or gentle behaviour.
Harsh speech should always be avoided.
Instead of it we should behave well with others.
It is absolutely necessary to speak honest and meaningful words.
Avoiding all these four kinds of speech, everybody should speak well as the time demands.
Friendly speech is always welcome.
Cordial and moderate speech makes an enemy a friend, so is the right speech.
It means honest deeds devoid of killing the animals, stealing and sexual misconduct.
The performer of right deeds is known as an honest man as well as man of glory in the society.
Such a man abstains from giving severe punishment to others upholding amity towards all beings.
He never takes anything which is not given to him i.e. he abstains from stealing.
He is always respectful to his parents, brothers and sisters.
He possesses a great respect to the mothers, sisters and wives of others.
He earns his livelihood by right deeds and does good for the welfare of all.
It means honest or right deeds.
One who earns one's livelihood committing no sin in words or deeds is the right livelihood.
It further means to earn livelihood without causing loss to the society.
He should maintain his family by agriculture, business, teaching and official services.
In both service and business none should be deceived in any way.
Leading the life, in this way is the right livelihood.
It means a positive determination and enthusiasm.
These four kinds of mental effort must be exercised.
So it is further known as right mental effort.
As to keep good health man takes physical exercise so he can make his mind peaceful performing mental exercise.
It indicates to recollect the good deeds previously done again and again.
By means of the right mindfulness the devotee observes the religious practices and rejects those which should not be practiced.
He can differentiate the right or wrong.
He further understands the practices to be performed or not to be.
Right mindfulness helps the devotee to perform everything correctly living a virtuous life.
He can conquer vice, hatred, anger, greed and ignorance.
Right mindfulness is highly effective leading the devotee to attain Nibbana.
Samadhi means the concentration of mind.
It keeps human mind concentrated in a single object either physical or mental.
Human mind is naturally restless.
If restlessness is not controlled no good deed may be performed by the devotee.
The student who cannot control his mind to absorb in studies he fails to memories his lessons.
As soon as the mind is concentrated the student is able to learn his lessons by heart.
The right concentration is of four kinds or stages namely, the first, the second, the third and the fourth stages respectively.
In the first stage, the devotee has to give up all sorts of earthly pleasures.
In the second stage, he becomes steady.
The devotee feels the physical happiness in the third stage.
In the fourth stage, he advances towards perfect knowledge paying heed to the previous happenings.
While performing the Eightfold Path the body should be free from all kinds of troubles.
Again the devotee should not enjoy the earthly pleasure.
Every organ of the Eightfold Path abandons the two extremities.
As for instance, addiction to food and drinks, enjoyment etc. are the ideals of those who hanker after earthly pleasure.
Again weakening the body by fasting is another extremity.
The middle of these two extremities is known as the middle path.
The eight organs of the Noble Eightfold Path follow the middle path.
So observance of the middle path helps to attain Nibbana, the absolute and ultimate goal of Buddhism.
The world is transitory and full of sufferings, there is no existence of the soul.
In brief these are called the transient, sorrowful and soulless.
For salvation from sufferings there are eight ways that included in the Four Noble Truth.
Observing these paths Nibbana is attained.
Nibbana is the everlasting happiness and treasure of life.
The Noble Eightfold Path is the step to advance for attaining Nibbana.
In the first step there is suffering.
Suffering originates from craving.
Right view is necessary for removing the craving.
Right view helps human being to do good to others.
Noble activities are impossible to perform in the wrong way with evil mentality.
If you want to pass the examination and prosper in life you have to go forward with right view.
You should obey your teachers and concentrate yourself in studies to get good result in the examination.
In this way you have to proceed with right view and right thought to attain Nibbana.
On the other hand, right effort is not enough, rather you have to perform it in the right way.
Right speech should also be performed.
Because telling lies, shouting, rebuking or evil talks etc. create chaos and confusion in the family as well as in the society.
It causes a great loss to us.
Right speech should be spoken for peace and tranquility in the family and the society as well.
Thereafter comes right action.
Without performing right action no benefit is gained.
So right action is essential.
Right livelihood depends on right action.
Noble activities are never done living a dishonest life.
Right action and right livelihood are not enough to lead our life in a right way.
We should strive for progress in life.
Because temptation of evil activities influences man everywhere.
We should be careful so that our mind may not be influenced by any wrong deeds in any way.
Right mindfulness is highly necessary for achieving super mundane path.
We should think over the matter free from all sorts of mistakes.
We should lead our mind in the proper way.
Right mindfulness follows the Right meditation.
We should overcome our body, mind and the earthly happenings by dint of Right meditation.
Indecent and unholy performances have been overcome previously.
Now it requires to overcome the good will.
By dint of the right meditation the devotee over comes the earthly bondage leading to salvation.
The happiness of salvation is known as Nibbana.
Nibbana is rightly understood when every stage of the Noble Eightfold Path is duly observed.
The excellence of good deeds is achieved by sacrifice and practice.
Exercising all these practices Siddhartha attained Buddhahood and finally Nibbana.
